description: A Financial-Payment is a payment from government to a recipient

source_jurisdiction.description: Jurisdiction of the source of the data

data.description: This is an array of data objects, that is the objects which actually contain the data about the datum. Generally there will only be one element in this, although in for some types of data_types there may naturally be several releated to the same company, e.g. shareholders

company.description: A company which is the subject of a statement

identifier.description: An official identifier paired with a code for the issuer of the identifier, e.g sec/12345

payee_name.description: The name of the payee (the entity that received the money)

currency.description: The currency of the payment (three letter symbol, e.g. USD, GBP, EUR)

date.description: The date on which the payment was made

transaction_number.description: The unique identifier for the transaction, scoped to this bot

jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction of the body that made the payment, eg. UK, France, Delaware, Manchester

more_details_url.description: A url from which more details can be seen (may be the same as the source_url)

description.description: The description of the transaction as given in the raw data

expense_type.description: The type of expense -- can be either capital, revenue (i.e. current expenditure) or null

entity_name.description: The name of the government entity that made the payment, e.g. Environment Agency

entity_uri.description: A unique URL (ideally a dereferencable URI) for the government entity

department_name.description: The name of the government department which the entity belongs to (if relevant), e.g. Department of Health

csv_line_number.description: If the source for the data is a CSV file, you can optionally include the line number of the CSV from which this data was retrieved
